meanings.definition: The quality or state of being felonious.
meanings.sent1: The feloniousnesses of the crime were evident in the court.
meanings.sent2: His feloniousnesses were exposed when the stolen goods were found in his possession.
meanings.sent3: The detective couldn't help but chuckle at the feloniousnesses of the clumsy thief.
meanings.sent4: The dark alley was filled with an air of feloniousnesses, making everyone uneasy.
meanings.sent5: The newspaper headline screamed about the feloniousnesses of the notorious gang.

meanings.definition: The act of committing a felony.
meanings.sent1: After the feloniousnesses, the criminal was swiftly apprehended by the police.
meanings.sent2: The feloniousnesses of the robbery shocked the small town.
meanings.sent3: The daring feloniousnesses of the bank heist left everyone speechless.
meanings.sent4: The feloniousnesses of the crime scene painted a grim picture for the investigators.
meanings.sent5: The courtroom was filled with tension as the judge discussed the feloniousnesses of the accused.
